uk.ac.soton.simulation.jsit.anylogic

Class StochasticAccessorAnyLogic<S extends AbstractStochasticItem>

  • java.lang.Object
    • uk.ac.soton.simulation.jsit.core.AbstractStochasticAccessInfo
      • uk.ac.soton.simulation.jsit.anylogic.StochasticAccessorAnyLogic<S>
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable

    public class StochasticAccessorAnyLogic<S extends AbstractStochasticItem>
extends AbstractStochasticAccessInfo
implements java.io.Serializable
    This allows for the use of stochastic items that are shared between instances of some class (e.g., an AnyLogic Agent) that are for the same model run. (When using parallel runs of multi-run experiments, you will have instances of model classes for all parallel runs 'mixed together' in a single JVM.)

    This is an AnyLogic-specific variant of the standard version which works round AnyLogic threading issues (and should always be used for AnyLogic models).

    Since:
    0.2
    Author:
    Stuart Rossiter
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      StochasticAccessorAnyLogic(java.lang.Class<?> owner, java.lang.String id)
      Create an 'empty' accessor, normally held statically to access the per-run stochastic item across all instances of the class (in a way that works around AnyLogic threading issues).

    • Constructor Detail

      • StochasticAccessorAnyLogic

        public StochasticAccessorAnyLogic(java.lang.Class<?> owner,
                                  java.lang.String id)
        Create an 'empty' accessor, normally held statically to access the per-run stochastic item across all instances of the class (in a way that works around AnyLogic threading issues).
        Parameters:
        owner - The class owning (using) the stochastic item.
        id - A user-provided ID to define this stochastic item (used in stochastic control configuration files together with the owning class name).
        Since:
        0.2

    • Method Detail

      • registerAccessorFreeStochItem

        public static void registerAccessorFreeStochItem(java.lang.Class<?> owner,
                                                 java.lang.String id,
                                                 com.anylogic.engine.Agent agentInModel,
                                                 AbstractStochasticItem stochItem)
        Register a stochastic item for use without an accessor for access. This should only be done when using the item with singleton model classes (where it does not have to be shared between instances), and holding it as an instance field (i.e., not statically).
        Parameters:
        owner - The class owning (using) the stochastic item.
        agentInModel - Any Agent instance that is part of the model. This method will actually search for the closest 'parent' MainModel_AnyLogic instance, so passing that (if available directly) will speed up the call.
        id - A user-provided ID to define this stochastic item (used in stochastic control configuration files together with the owning class name).
        stochItem - The stochastic item to register.
        Since:
        0.2

      • addForRun

        public void addForRun(com.anylogic.engine.Agent agentInModel,
                      S stochItem)
        Thread-safe method to add a stochastic item for the current run. This should only ever be called once per run.
        Parameters:
        agentInModel - Any Agent instance that is part of the model. This method will actually search for the closest 'parent' MainModel_AnyLogic instance, so passing that (if available directly) will speed up the call.
        stochItem - The stochastic item being added.
        Since:
        0.2

      • getForRun

        public S getForRun(com.anylogic.engine.Agent agentInModel)
        Thread-safe method to get the stochastic item for the current run.
        Parameters:
        agentInModel - Any Agent instance that is part of the model. This method will actually search for the closest 'parent' MainModel_AnyLogic instance, so passing that (if available directly) will speed up the call.
        Returns:
        The stochastic item for the run.
        Since:
        0.2
